learningOutcomes: Enhance emotional intelligence in customer interactions

scenes.title: Introduction to Difficult People
scenes.onScreenText: Welcome to Dealing with Difficult People
scenes.voiceover: Welcome to this training module on dealing with difficult people. Let's explore the types of challenging customers you may encounter.
scenes.visuals: A friendly customer service representative greeting the audience.
scenes.accessibilityNotes: Ensure captions are enabled for the voiceover.
scenes.developerNotes: Full-screen layout, soft transition into the next scene.

scenes.title: Types of Difficult Customers
scenes.onScreenText: Types of Difficult Customers: 1. The Angry Customer 2. The Indecisive Customer 3. The Know-It-All
scenes.voiceover: There are several types of difficult customers. Let's take a closer look at three common types: the angry customer, the indecisive customer, and the know-it-all.
scenes.visuals: Illustrations of each customer type with brief descriptions.
scenes.accessibilityNotes: Provide alt text for each illustration.
scenes.developerNotes: Use a grid layout for customer types, with animations for each type appearing sequentially.

scenes.title: Understanding Customer Emotions
objectivesCovered: Enhance emotional intelligence in customer interactions
scenes.voiceover: Understanding the emotions behind a customer's behavior is crucial. Let's discuss how to recognize these emotions.
scenes.visuals: A diagram showing different customer emotions and their triggers.
scenes.accessibilityNotes: Include captions for the diagram explanation.
scenes.developerNotes: Use a dynamic diagram that highlights each emotion as discussed.

scenes.title: Effective Communication Strategies
scenes.voiceover: Effective communication can de-escalate difficult situations. Here are some strategies you can use.
scenes.visuals: Bullet points listing strategies such as active listening, empathy, and clear language.
scenes.accessibilityNotes: Ensure all text is readable with sufficient contrast.
scenes.developerNotes: Use a fade-in effect for each bullet point.

scenes.title: Role-Playing Scenarios
scenes.voiceover: Now, let's practice what we've learned through role-playing scenarios.
scenes.visuals: Two characters in a role-play scenario, one as the customer and one as the representative.
scenes.interactivity: Participants will choose responses to the customer's statements.
scenes.accessibilityNotes: Provide keyboard navigation for response selection.
scenes.developerNotes: Interactive layout with branching scenarios based on user choices.

scenes.title: Conflict Resolution Techniques
scenes.voiceover: Let's explore some effective conflict resolution techniques to help you manage difficult interactions.
scenes.accessibilityNotes: Include alt text for the flowchart.
scenes.developerNotes: Use a step-by-step reveal for each part of the flowchart.

scenes.title: Summary and Key Takeaways
objectivesCovered: Enhance emotional intelligence in customer interactions
scenes.voiceover: In summary, remember the types of difficult customers, the importance of effective communication, and the techniques for conflict resolution.
scenes.visuals: A recap slide with key points highlighted.
scenes.accessibilityNotes: Ensure all key points are clearly visible and readable.
scenes.developerNotes: Simple layout with a smooth transition to the conclusion.

scenes.title: Conclusion and Next Steps
scenes.voiceover: Thank you for participating in this training. Apply these strategies in your daily interactions.
scenes.visuals: A thank you message with a friendly image.
scenes.accessibilityNotes: Provide a summary of resources for further learning.
